thread.title: Club distributes stationery among poor girl students
thread.title_full: Club distributes stationery among poor girl students

author: tribuneindia.com
title: Club distributes stationery among poor girl students
text:
Tribune News Service
Mussoorie, September 30
Members of the Inner Wheel Club, Mussoorie, distributed stationery and eatable items among needy students of Government Girls Middle School at Camelâ€™s Back Road here today. The members also felicitated teachers for their contribution towards educating students from poor families. The president of the club, Neerja Pandhi, said the students should take care of cleanliness and hygiene, besides education. She said students could start by creating awareness about cleanliness in their neighbourhood and then carry it forward to other areas. She appealed to them not to use polythene bags in the town. She presented awards and citations to teacher Nimesh Dangwal, assistant teachers Kiran Joshi, Rani Kanojia and Sunita. Bhojan Mata Darshni Devi was also felicitated for her services on the occasion. Executive members of the club Rashim Karnwal, Manishi Sanghal, Sarika Gupta, Reeta Jain, Anu Garg, Jaya Kanrwal and Reena Mathur were present on the occasion.
